headline: The Score: Tesla, Cleveland-Cliffs, Dollar General and More Stocks That Defined the Week
summary: President Trump unveiled the higher duties at a rally on May 30 promoting a $14 billion deal between Japan’s  Nippon Steel  and  U.S. Steel  which he said would ensure U.S. control over the company.  Trump said that the move to increase the levies, which took effect June 4, would bolster the domestic industry and protect U.S. jobs.  Cleveland-Cliffs  shares surged 23% on Monday, while  Steel Dynamics  and  Nucor  shares each gained 10%.
